Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.server.model

Class MatchModel

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.server.model.MatchModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class MatchModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
The model represents the state of a match. It contains the data representing the board and the players and the main logic of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • MatchModel

      public MatchModel​(MatchController controller) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructor of Match. Since players don't require any previous data except for username, the order of setup doesn't matter.
      Parameters:
      controller - the controller of the match
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's a problem creating the board

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Entry point for MatchController logic. Sets up the game and runs indefinitely the gameloop. It terminates on game end or if a connection exception occurs.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • setupGame

      private void setupGame() throws java.io.IOException
      Helper function to setup the game. Does the following things: - gets usernames from players - asks the room leader to choose the gods of the game - asks each player to choose their god - asks the room leader to choose the game leader - asks each player to place their worker (twice)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's a connection error

    • gameLoop

      private void gameLoop() throws java.io.IOException
      Main gameloop function. Consists of an infinite loop that plays the turn indefinitely until either a connection error occurs or a end game event is detected.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's a connection error

    • playersPlaceWorkers

      private void playersPlaceWorkers() throws java.io.IOException
      Helper function of setupGame. Asks all players to place their workers
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - a connection error occurs

    • getLastAction

      public Action getLastAction()
      Returns:
      the last action executed

    • executeAction

      public void executeAction​(Action action) throws java.io.IOException
      Executes an action on the Match and adds it to the history upon completion
      Parameters:
      action - the action to execute
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs

    • getPlayerMap

      public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayerMap()
      Returns:
      an array containing all player models.

    • applyBeforeTurnEffects

      private void applyBeforeTurnEffects​(java.lang.String player) throws java.io.IOException
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • applyAfterTurnEffects

      private void applyAfterTurnEffects​(java.lang.String player, int workerIndex) throws java.io.IOException
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • turn

      private void turn​(java.lang.String player) throws java.io.IOException
      Main game logic functions. Executes the following: - calls the beforeTurn effects of all gods - asks the player for the worker to move and build - executes the move and build phases - calls the afterTurn effects of all gods
      Parameters:
      player - the player of the turn
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs

    • getMovableWorkers

      private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getMovableWorkers​(java.lang.String player) throws java.io.IOException
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • move

      public boolean move​(java.lang.String player, int workerIndex) throws java.io.IOException
      Function that implements all logic relative to the move phase. In order: - - calls the beforeMove effect of all gods - gets all valid move actions - gets the choice from the client - executes the chosen action - calls the afterMove effects of all gods
      Parameters:
      player - the moving player
      workerIndex - the index of the moving worker
      Returns:
      true if the move succeeded, false if the player lost
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs

    • build

      public boolean build​(java.lang.String player, int workerIndex) throws java.io.IOException
      Function that implements all logic relative to the build phase. In order: - calls the beforeBuild effect of all gods - gets all valid build actions - gets the choice from the client - executes the chosen action - calls the afterBuild effects of all gods
      Parameters:
      player - the building player
      workerIndex - the index of the building worker
      Returns:
      true if the build succeeded, false if the player lost
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs

    • end

      public void end​(java.lang.String winningPlayer) throws EndGameException, java.io.IOException
      Ends the game by throwing an EndGameException.
      Parameters:
      winningPlayer - the name of the winning player
      Throws:
      EndGameException - always, to notify the turn function and terminate the Match thread
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs

    • lose

      public void lose​(java.lang.String losingPlayer) throws java.io.IOException
      Removes a losing player and its workers, and calls end if only one player is left.
      Parameters:
      losingPlayer - the losing player
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs

    • getPlayerByUsername

      public Player getPlayerByUsername​(java.lang.String username)
      Retrieve a Player object by username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the Player
      Returns:
      the associated Player

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()

    • getWorkerPositions

      private java.util.ArrayList<Point> getWorkerPositions()
      Retrieve the position of all workers (of all players).
      Returns:
      an array containing the workers' positions

    • isCellFree

      public boolean isCellFree​(Point position)
      Check if the target cell contains a worker.
      Parameters:
      position - the cell you want to check
      Returns:
      true if the cell does not contain a worker

    • getMovements

      public java.util.List<MoveAction> getMovements​(java.lang.String playerName, int worker) throws java.io.IOException
      Retrieve a list of the possible move actions a player can do.
      Parameters:
      playerName - player to move
      worker - index of worker to move
      Returns:
      the array of possible MoveActions
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs

    • getBuildable

      public java.util.List<BuildAction> getBuildable​(java.lang.String player, int worker) throws java.io.IOException
      Retrieve a list of the possible build actions a player can do.
      Parameters:
      player - player who builds
      worker - index of worker who builds
      Returns:
      the array of possible MoveActions
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs
